instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight goes on for a moment then shuts off
threads.message: This macbook turns on with no backlight and soon after the backlight tries to turn on and then goes back out. It boots up to the login screen and then whole computer shuts down. I notice the computer only turns on by itself and not when I press the power button. Except when I do an SMC reset the keyboard seems unresponsive. For example if I hold down the power button to try and shut it down, nothing happens. Same goes for when I try to do a hardware test holding down the D key and PRAM reset. Trackpad also seems to not be present as far as I can see when I hold a light to the back of the LCD. I also tried powering up without the keyboard in case it's liquid damaged but the computer still shuts down after the login screen. LCD back light circuit reads normal, replaced driver IC as well. I can't see any signs of liquid damage or corrosion, just cat hair at first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight goes on for a moment then shuts off
threads.message:
Tried the board without trackpad flex too?
In fact, try the board without any device, nor even LCD, nor SSD; use just USB mouse, or external OSX pendrive (with LED Link) for activity test.
Also be sure to use original 60/85W Magsafe 2 charger.
Flash clean ME BIOS, if still same issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight goes on for a moment then shuts off
threads.message: Sounds like <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> issue inspect the hall sensor
